meanings.definition: A hymn or psalm sung at the beginning of a Christian religious service.
meanings.sent1: The introits at church always set a peaceful tone for the service.
meanings.sent2: The choir sang the introits beautifully before the sermon.
meanings.sent3: The introits at the church service made everyone feel calm and serene.
meanings.sent4: The introits floated through the air like gentle whispers of comfort.
meanings.sent5: The introits echoed in the sanctuary, filling hearts with reverence.

meanings.definition: The beginning or opening of something.
meanings.sent1: The introits of the book immediately captured my attention.
meanings.sent2: The introits of the movie were full of suspense and excitement.
meanings.sent3: The introits of the meeting were unexpectedly lively and engaging.
meanings.sent4: The introits of the play signaled the start of a thrilling performance.
meanings.sent5: The introits of the event marked the commencement of a memorable evening.
